page.title: 16A BIRDS EYE VIEW OF SUTTON.
page.content: A bird flying north-west from the River Trent enters this D block over rolling farmland.Soon this gives way to new housing,factories and a railway line.To its right is a large recreation ground with a boating lake and tennis courts,to its left hosiery mills and motor dealers.Now the centre,three-storey buildings,a school with a pyramid roof,a busy new shopping centre and bus station by the side of the stalls of an open market.On it flies,the buildings are fewer;in this field,next to the cemetery,the wakes and the fairs are held.Housing estates come into view and,in the distance,open fields and the rising green mound that hides Sutton Colliery.
